GenAiFunction.description: - Use this when the user corrects you, expresses dissatisfaction with your response, or asks you to remember something for future conversations - Store user preferences, corrections, and specific instructions about how they want you to behave, communicate, AND use tools - Custom instructions cover everything: communication style, tool usage patterns, when to use specific tools, operational preferences - Examples: user wants tables instead of lists, prefers more technical detail, wants specific formatting, dislikes certain approaches, prefers specific tools for certain tasks - The summary should briefly describe what to remember (max 80 characters): "User prefers tables over lists" - The instruction should specify when and how to apply this: "When showing data results, format as tables instead of bullet points" - After storing, acknowledge: "I'll remember that preference for future interactions" and immediately apply the new instruction - This creates persistent memory that improves your responses in all future conversations with this user
